sub_title: Ecological artist, Founder Woven studio,  3x Ted speaker, fellow at VU university
summary:
In my work I seamlessly combine scientific research and new technologies to deliver an empowering experience that is accessible both intellectually and technologically.

My immersive art installations, often described as eco- or awareness art, turn the impact of climate change, air pollution, ocean plastic, diversity, data misuse into a tangible experience. Using a fluid mixture of data, nature, kinetic motion, water, digital visualisations, analog elements, the virtual and real worlds.

Currently I hold a teaching position at the Delft University of Technology (NL) and a Fellowship at the VU University and founded Woven studio to bridge the gap between science and culture.

I have won awards like the prestigious Lumen prize for digital art, got nominated for the Stars Prize from Ars Electronica, and the New Technology Art Award and has exhibited at Fondation Cartier pour l’art contemporain Paris (FR), Today Art Museum (CN), Stedelijk Museum Amsterdam (NL), Science Gallery Dublin (IE), SXSW (USA), Science Centre Kuwait (KW), MU Gallery (NL) and have been featured in Wired, New Scientist, Financial Times and Discovery Channel.

projects.title: Run like a refugee
projects.description:
Run like a Refugee 
Was an interactive installation that let people experience the feeling of being a refugee. 
By using the Immersive Vr experience ( oculus rift ) and combining this with an treadmill the user could run in the footsteps of the true story of Himan Machmudi on his horrible journey from Iran to the Netherlands.     2 Times Webby Nominee and now piece of the Refugee Museum in DenHague.

contributors.headline: Ecological artist, Founder Woven studio,  3x Ted speaker, fellow at VU university

projects.title: de Persgroep- Creative Incubator
projects.description:
Initiator - Founder ,Creative Director of the creative Incubator of the Volkskrant. 
With the Creative Press challenge we bring innovation and creativity into the hearth of the 
newspaper marked thats in the midst of Disruption. 
 
The Creative Press Challenge is a challenge for creatives to create ads for good 
causes.  Based on the insight that an bad idea can not hide in print. 

We made a award winning launch film and the second and in 2014 we created the 
 insight installation where creatives ran like a refugee using a Oculus Rift + Treadmill.

contributors.headline: Ecological artist, Founder Woven studio,  3x Ted speaker, fellow at VU university

profile_positions.description:
In times where the facts about climate change, deforestation and the anthropocene can be overwhelming and even numbing,  I create interactive art installations that turn these topics into relatable art installations that make people feel the facts again. 
 
Working together with lead scientists like Stefano Mancuso and organisations like UNESCO me and my team create interactive art installations that make climate science accessible both intellectual and technological.

My immersive art installations are often described as ecoart or awareness art. In my work I use the latest technologies to turn visitors into ocean plastic, give a voice to nature using data coming from living trees or let a physical digital rainforest disappear in front of your eyes.

In my work I was lucky to work with the best scientists from ESA to Unesco,  from the Florance university to the Natural History Museum.  My work has been widely awarded. It has won the prestigious Lumen Prize for digital art, is nominated for the Stars Prize from Ars Electronica and the New Technology Art Award. He has exhibited at Fondation Cartier pour l’art contemporain Paris (FR), Today Art Museum (CN), Stedelijk Museum Amsterdam (NL), Science Gallery Dublin (IE), SXSW (USA), Science Centre Kuwait (KW), Mu Gallery (NL) and has been featured in Wired, New Scientist, Financial Times and Discovery Channel and even the Donald Duck.
profile_positions.title: Ecological Artist ( founder )

profile_positions.description:
Woven studio created science communication for a new generation in a sustainable and accessible way.

Clients include :  European Space Agency , University Leiden, Science Gallery, Daily Paper,  Artis, fondation cartier pour l'art contemporain, LIVN lab,   Florence University,  Bonn University, Today Art Museum , TU Delft and many more.
profile_positions.title: Founder

profile_positions.description: As an Artist on the edge of science and art I help shaping the program of the Broader mind cross all levels of the university.  Through workshops, lectures and creative counceling we will weave creativity into the field of science communication to give the reserach reach.
profile_positions.title: Fellowship

profile_positions.description: Within the framework of the Masters Honours Programme we help students to be better prepared to participate in the emotional-moral debate that is associated to new technologies and fronteering research through the lens of art.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer Art, ethics and Empathy

profile_positions.description: Amp.Amsterdam amplifies brands with the power of sound. The innovation team is responsible to add sound in the most innovative and groundbreaking ways possible.
profile_positions.title: Director Of Innovation | Partner

profile_positions.description: Artist in residence at one of the best technical universities of the world.  We will be building a interactive art installation called the Watchtowers, where we put the smartest brains in ridiculous mode.
profile_positions.title: Artist In Residence

profile_positions.description:
Circulair economy design studio we turn (plastic) waste streams into new products. 
Owned projects: Refil ,turning old car dashboards into 3d printer ink that sells worldwide.  
New Marble, tiles made from old bottles.  Brands:  Oneill, Corona, KLM, Ruik, broodnodig.
profile_positions.title: Chief Creative Officer | Partner

profile_positions.description: Oat shoes-  fully biodegradable sneakers. Based on circulair economy principles. You can put them in the ground and a tree grows out of them. As a Co-Creative Director  we have set up Oat Shoes, winning the 2nd prize in Sustainable Fashion week Amsterdam and sprouting baby shoes version called Oaties.
profile_positions.title: Creative Director

profile_positions.description: At W+K I Created award winning campaigns and experiences for Global Brands like Coca-Cola, Heineken, Levis, Nike, Lego, EA sports, Ferrero, GE, Dutch Film Museum, and r.i.p Nokia.
profile_positions.title: Creative
